result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Markevius Cortez Peavy Sr

records.addlTxt: Court orders that $2,500 signature bond remains as well as all other previously ordered conditions.
Defendant in court. Attorney Kylan Reilly appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Br 29.

Defendant Markevius Cortez Peavy Sr not in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Markevius Cortez Peavy Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Markevius Cortez Peavy Sr appeared by phone.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Markevius Cortez Peavy Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Markevius Cortez Peavy Sr appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Markevius Cortez Peavy Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that he received discovery materials, but needs additional time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case set for a scheduling conference on 7/29/22 at 8:30 am. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Case is rescheduled to 8/30/22 at 8:30 am. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Markevius Cortez Peavy in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Calendar call held. Court cancels the stayed bench warrant. Defense counsel needs discovery and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a pre-trial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Calendar call scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant previously posted $1450 cash bail. Court orders $1450 cash bail returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JMD.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Markevius Cortez Peavy in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
